content.text:
# 1999 St. George Illawarra Dragons season

|league=NRL|league_champions=|league_draws=0|league_losses=10|league_rank=6th|league_wins=18|list=|next_season=2000|playoff_result=Runners-Up|points_against=472|points_for=692|prev_season=|stadium=Jubilee Oval,
Wollongong Showground|top_goals=Wayne Bartrim (71)|top_points=Wayne Bartrim (162)|top_tries=Nathan Blacklock (24)|year=1999}}The 1999 St. George Illawarra Dragons season was the first in the joint venture club's history. The Dragons competed in the NRL's 1999 premiership season. The team finished sixth in the regular season, before making and losing the grand final against the Melbourne Storm in front of a record-breaking crowd, with 107,999 people in attendance at the new Stadium Australia.
